Description.val:
The Satellite Communications (SATCOM) Systems P-1 line provides funds for procurement of shipboard terminal equipment for ship-to-ship, ship-to-shore and ship-to-aircraft tactical communications via earth orbiting relay satellites.   This includes Radio Frequency (RF) equipment and baseband equipment assembled and grouped into systems and subsystems structured to address specific naval communications requirements.   These systems provide modem processors and peripheral equipment that control the RF links for message traffic, direct data transfer and secure voice communications.  They are selected and oriented by communications traffic levels, types of communications and operational missions. Commercial Broadband Satellite Program (CBSP) technical refresh of system modems and Ka Kits will directly support Assured Command and Control (AC2) posture, SATCOM reliability, space resiliency via band diversity and redundancy.  AC2 modems enable the use of Wideband Global Satellite (WGS) X-Band (ship/submarine transmit and receive) and Ka-band (shore receive and transmit) resources to maintain link connectivity to provide assured access to mission critical communications in Anti-Access Anti-Denial (A2AD) jamming environments.

Demand Assigned Multiple Access (DAMA)/ Miniaturized DAMA:  Ultra High Frequency (UHF) DAMA and MINI DAMA systems supports Command and Control (C2) voice and data communications over Satellite and Line of Sight (LOS) links. Cryptographic modernization is required for UHF systems to continue use and enable operations (e.g. Ballistic Missile Defense (BMD), Tomahawk Strike Network (TSN) and Intelligence Broadcast Services (IBS). Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Instruction (CJCSI) 6510.02E directs the military Services to modernize National Security Agency (NSA) certified cryptographic products and algorithms prior to published Last Year of Use dates to ensure secure, interoperable information sharing. NSA's published de-certification and cease key dates for crypto algorithm contained in UHF legacy communications systems. Funding provides for the engineering, testing, procurement and product integration.

Joint UHF MILSATCOM Networks Integrated Control System (JMINI CS): Funding supports procurement and installation of mission related JMINI CS equipment in support of MILCON C4I Shore Based Enterprise Network Enhancements. JMINI CS provides SATCOM capability over increasingly limited satellite channels and provides remote system monitoring and end user troubleshooting capability to facilitate warfighter communications in operational missions and training exercises. This non-recurring MILCON Shore Enhancement requirement will ensure continued capability to the fleet during the transition between the old and new facility at Naval Computer and Telecommunications Area Master Station (NCTAMS) Atlantic.

[P5 / (NR112) Commercial Broadband Satellite Assured C2 Modems]: CBSP Assured C2 Modems:  Directly support Assured Command and Control (C2) posture, SATCOM reliability, space resiliency via band diversity and redundancy for MILSATCOM. 
 
FY21 continues the procurement of modems and peripheral equipment to the CBSP terminal to provide technology refresh and directly support Assured Command and Control (C2) communications.

[P5 / (NR112) CBSP Ka Kits]: CBSP KA Kits: Current National focus is on highly contested environments and has highlighted a growing need of protected communications, specifically in a satellite denied environment. Assured Command and Control (AC2) Ka Band Kits will increase band diversity and access to Wideband Global SATCOM (WGS) and mitigates risk of loss of Beyond Line of Sight (BLOS) wideband communications in a SATCOM-denied environment for the CBSP Program. With this capability, CBSP will be able to reduce risk of loss of C2 communications on Unit Level Variant (ULV)/ Field Level Variant (FLV) class Combatant ships in a denied environment which would assure Command and Control (C2) including ISR, NIPR/SIPR, VTC, and other critical capabilities.

In FY21, CBSP continues the procurement and installation of 5 ULV Ka Band Kits. CBSP will commence procurement and installation of 6 Force Level Kits (FLV) Ka Band Kits.

[P3A / (NR117) Global Broadcast Service (GBS)]: GLOBAL BROADCAST SERVICE (GBS - NR117): GBS is a Joint Military Satellite Communications (MILSATCOM) program with the Air Force as Executive Agent for all services. GBS provides a continuous, high speed, one way information flow of high volume data to units ashore, afloat or special operations. GBS supports routine operations, training and military exercises, special activities, crises, situational awareness, weapons targeting, and reconnaissance. Deployment of GBS internet protocol (IP) terminals will allow expanded use of military intelligence collection in a broader spectrum using MILSATCOM architecture. The Navy GBS Split IP effort enables near-real-time duplex asymmetric communications connectivity to ships/subs. GBS plays a pivotal role to support the Assured Command and Control (AC2) environment.

[P3A - 2 / (NR112) Commercial Broadband Satellite program (CBSP) - Afloat]: CBSP is the U.S. Navy Commercial Satellite Communications (SATCOM) program that provides the only source of wideband SATCOM to Patrol Coastal (PC) and Mine Countermeasure (MCM) Ships, diversity for Military Satellite Communications (MILSATCOM) on Unit Level Variant (ULV) ships, and augments MILSATCOM on Force Level Variant (FLV) ships. CBSP will support the procurement and installation of a commercial terminal and service architecture that significantly increase data throughput, Navy A2AD posture, and communication reliability.  CBSP also increases space resiliency by providing band diversity, assured access, and redundancy for MILSATCOM. Included in the program are Small Ship Variant (SSV - Patrol Coastal and Mine Countermeasure Ships), Unit Level Variant (ULV - including Guided Missile Destroyers and Guided Missile Frigates), and Force Level Variant (FLV - large combatant ships including Carriers).

Justification.val:
The FY21 funding request increases meet Assured Command and Control (AC2) requirements for Global Broadcast System (GBS) Afloat Terminals and Commercial Broadband Satellite Program (CBSP) Terminals.  Specifically, the GBS AC2 increase resides in the Engineering Change Order (ECO) and adds X-Band reception to provide coverage to Naval Forces when Ka-band beam coverage is not available or to support higher priority missions.  The ECO procures hardware, engineering services and installations to support critical X-Band capability to the Fleet. CBSP increase includes additional Ka Kit procurements and installations. Ka kits increase band diversity and access to wide band Global SATCOM providing bandwidth capability that mitigates beyond line of sight (BLOS)

The FY21 funding request continues procurement of both Afloat and Portable Global Broadcast System (GBS) Program Receive Terminals and an Engineering Change Order (ECO) to meet the Navy's Microsoft Windows 10 requirement Cyber Security Mandate (dated 08 December 2016).  The ECO procures Public Key Infrastructure (PKI) hardware, engineering services and installations to support critical information assurance to the Fleet. 

The FY21 funding request continues Commercial Broadband Satellite Program (CBSP) procurement and installation of Unit Level Variant (ULV) and Force Level Variant (FLV) Terminals.  Continues procurement and installation of CBSP modem technical refresh and Ka Kit upgrades.  All of which are in direct support of Assured Command and Control (AC2) U.S. Navy afloat mission objectives.

FY21 funding request is for the required engineering changes necessary to implement cybersecurity upgrades and cryptographic modernization for increased performance and security for the Demand Assigned Multiple Access (DAMA)/ MINI DAMA system. 

Joint UHF MILSATCOM Networks Integrated Control System (JMINI CS) increase in FY21 due to funds transfer from Shore IW Platform (BLI 8161) to procure, integrate and install the JMINI CS capability at the new NCTAMS Atlantic Facility in alignment with the Facilities Beneficiary Occupancy Date.

Name.@footnote: Consolidated Prior Year Requirements costs of $934,606K which includes GBS Modem Upgrades, GBS Interim Modem Upgrades, GBS Shore Pre-Installation Design, SHF, NESP, CBSP, and Spectral Warrior (SW) / Spider Net (SN), DAMA/MINI DAMA(LEGACY), JMINI Control System shore, CBSP Small Ship Variant (SSV)and JMINI CS Shore install dollars.

Mini-DAMA FY21 OPN funds the engineering required for the crypto modernization of the MD-1324 modems that must be completed by FY24. Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff Instruction (CJCSI) 6510.02E directs the military Services to modernize National Security Agency (NSA) certified cryptographic products and algorithms prior to published Last Year of Use dates to ensure secure, interoperable information sharing. NSA's published de-certification and cease key dates for crypto algorithm contained in UHF legacy communications systems.
Name.val: 2.1.1) DAMA/ MINI DAMA Engineering Change Order

Name.@footnote: [NR118 Hardware] Funding supports procurement of mission related JMINI CS equipment at new NCTAMS Atlantic facility.

Name.val: (NR112) Commercial Broadband Satellite Assured C2 Modems

Name.@footnote: FY21 CBSP Qty 59 modem procurements and installations support Afloat units comprising of Force Level and Unit Level ship variants.

Name.val: 5.1.2) Assured C2 Modem Upgrades - Not Installed

Name.@footnote: FY21 supports the procurement and installation of 5 Unit Level Variant Ka Kits in an effort to reduce risk of loss of C2 communications on Unit Level Variant (ULV) class Combatant ships in a denied environment which would assure Command and Control (C2).

FY21 supports the procurement and installation of 6 Force Level Variant Ka Kits in an effort to reduce risk of loss of C2 communications on Force Level Variant (FLV) class Combatant ships in a denied environment which would assure Command and Control (C2).

Name.val: 7.5) MILCON P-913 Shore Based Enterprise Network Enhancements-Organic

Name.@footnote: Pre-Installation Design Services Allocation (DSA) are required in order to complete ship check and installation drawings for installation planning and is performed 6-12 months prior to installation start. Post Installation DSA support requirements include drawings closeout. DSA costs will fluctuate each FY as it is a factor of the number of installations in any given fiscal year.  FY20 Congressional Mark of $757K applied to FY20  DSA for GBS Afloat Receive Terminal DSA Previously Funded.

Engineering Change Order (ECO) is required to implement Cybersecurity upgrades to increase system performance for fielded GBS Afloat Receive Terminals and Portable Receive Terminals. FY19-21 procures and installs Win 10 PKI upgrades and performs associated integration, assembly and test. Increase from FY20 to FY21 supports GBS ECO to add X-Band reception capability to provide coverage to Naval Forces when Ka-band beam coverage is not available or to support higher priority missions. Initial operating capability of this engineering changes begins fielding in FY21.

1.  FY 2021 GBS Afloat Receive Terminal Procurement and Installation continues fielding requirements for Resilient Command and Control (RC2) that provides support to Fleet missions: Strike & Special Operations, Imagery and Intel Data (Live Streaming Video).
1.  GBS Portable Receive Terminals are turn-key and therefore do not have installation costs associated with them.
Aqyr Techologies support Portable Receive Terminals

ImplementationMethodName.val: [none specified]:: Installation Name: Afloat Receive Terminal

Description.val: GLOBAL BROADCAST SERVICE (GBS - NR117): GBS is a Joint Military Satellite Communications (MILSATCOM) program with the Air Force as Executive Agent for all services.  GBS provides a continuous, high speed, one way information flow of high volume data to units ashore, afloat or special operations.  GBS supports routine operations, training and military exercises, special activities, crises, situational awareness, weapons targeting, and reconnaissance.  Deployment of GBS Internet Protocol (IP) terminals will allow expanded use of military intelligence collection in a broader spectrum using MILSATCOM architecture. The Navy GBS Split IP effort enables near-real-time duplex asymmetric communications connectivity to ships/subs.  GBS plays a pivotal role to support the AC2 environment.

Name.@footnote: Engineering changes required to implement bandwidth efficiency technologies to increase system performance for fielded Small Ship Variants (SSV) and Force Level Variants (FLV).

Pre-Installation Design Services Allocation (DSA) are required in order to complete ship check and installation drawings for installation planning and is performed 6-12 months prior to installation start. Post Installation DSA support requirements include drawings closeout. DSA costs will fluctuate each FY as it is a factor of the number of installations in any given fiscal year.

1.  FY19-FY24 Engineering Change Order (ECO) updates are re-prioritized to adjudicate FY19-FY24 CBSP Terminal Install and DSA funding levels required to complete scheduled installations to reflect updated fielding plan synchronization.  2.  FY21 installation cost increase compared to FY20 is driven by CBSP shipboard configuration type and platform type.  3.  FY21 procures Qty 7 CBSP Unit Level Variant (ULV) terminals to meet DDG ship class fielding requirements.
1.  Force Level Variant (FLV) terminals include single and dual antenna configurations which influences average unit cost.

ImplementationMethodName.val: Tiger Team:: Installation Name: Small Ship Variant (SSV), Unit Level Variant (ULV) and Force Level V

CBSP will support the procurement and installation of a commercial terminal and service architecture that significantly increase data throughput, Navy A2AD posture, and communication reliability.  CBSP also increases space resiliency by providing band diversity, assured access, and redundancy for MILSATCOM. Included in the program are Small Ship Variant (SSV - Patrol Coastal and Mine Countermeasure Ships), Unit Level Variant (ULV - including Guided Missile Destroyers and Guided Missile Frigates), and Force Level Variant (FLV - large combatant ships including Carriers).
